['', 'Knowledge of SQL', 'Tableau / data visualization experience a plus', 'Build predictive models to inform advanced insights, account prioritization, next-best-action, campaign optimization, and commercial test-and-learn for the sales and marketing orgs ', 'YOU WILL:', 'EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:', 'Experience working with Azure Databricks and Data Factory a plus', 'Perform predictive analytics to identify core opportunities to drive business value, utilizing machine learning techniques such as logistic regression, random forests, collaborative filtering, sentiment analysis and topic modeling', 'Degree from an accredited college/university in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, or related fieldMinimum of 2 years of professional experience working as a Data ScientistDemonstrated experience building deployed prediction models to create business value, preferably in sales and marketing applicationsExperience in building predictive models in Python (Pandas/PySpark preferred)Experience in large-scale/distributed computing and analytics (Spark)Strong statistics acumen including design of experimentsKnowledge of SQLExperience with source control and collaboration tools (e.g. Git and Github Enterprise)Experience working in Azure cloud environmentExperience in data engineering a plusTableau / data visualization experience a plusSoftware development / engineering experience a plusExperience in scaled model testing, integration, and deployment (DevOps) a plusExperience working in Microsoft tech stack including SQL Server and Azure preferredExperience working with Azure Databricks and Data Factory a plus', 'The position involves working with structured and unstructured real-world dat. You are comfortable thinking independently about solving business problems. You are self-motivated, detail-oriented, have the ability to work with limited supervision, and must be comfortable in an environment of changing priorities. You have a strong business acumen, with evidence of delivered business value, preferably in a commercial setting.', 'Experience in data engineering a plus', 'Demonstrated experience building deployed prediction models to create business value, preferably in sales and marketing applications', 'Minimum of 2 years of professional experience working as a Data Scientist', 'Generate buy-in and engagement by effectively communicating results through presentations and visualizations', 'You will', 'You will produce insightful analytic data models to capture and explain performance trends of sales while driving optimization opportunities and proactive direction for the organization. You will interface across the organization to answer challenging analytical questions and highlight customer-related insights, such as revenue generation ideas and strategies to detect and prevent potential customer defection. You will also produce creative solutions to complex business problems using advanced analytical techniques, while leveraging both internal and external data sources. The role will involve frequent interaction with key stakeholders across the sales and marketing organization. ', 'Build predictive models to inform advanced insights, account prioritization, next-best-action, campaign optimization, and commercial test-and-learn for the sales and marketing orgs Perform predictive analytics to identify core opportunities to drive business value, utilizing machine learning techniques such as logistic regression, random forests, collaborative filtering, sentiment analysis and topic modelingImplement, deploy and maintain ML augmented tools for users to act on insights and recommendations generated by models and analyticsGenerate buy-in and engagement by effectively communicating results through presentations and visualizations', 'Experience in scaled model testing, integration, and deployment (DevOps) a plus', 'Experience with source control and collaboration tools (e.g. Git and Github Enterprise)', 'Experience in building predictive models in Python (Pandas/PySpark preferred)', 'Strong statistics acumen including design of experiments', 'Degree from an accredited college/university in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, or related field', 'Experience in large-scale/distributed computing and analytics (Spark)', 'New Jersey based Biopharmaceutical company has built out an analytics enabled enhancement for their new go-to-market sales strategy. If you are a Data Scientist interested in Predictive Modeling and Machine Learning, we would love to speak with you! This role is 100% remote but will be onsite next year in Parsippany, NJ.', 'Experience working in Microsoft tech stack including SQL Server and Azure preferred', 'Experience working in Azure cloud environment', 'Implement, deploy and maintain ML augmented tools for users to act on insights and recommendations generated by models and analytics', 'Software development / engineering experience a plus']

['', 'A Master’s degree or equivalent experience in Data Science, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Machine Learning/AI or related fields.Demonstrated experience in all phases of managing data science projects including: problem definition, solution formulation, model building, productionizing and delivering measurable impact. ['·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Identify and evaluate additional data sources that could be integrated in value enhancing ways.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Take a leading role in developing data science as a discipline across product management, development and data operations.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Build reports, dashboards and/or other analyses as needed and/or as specific initiatives arise.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Support various commercial or commercialization efforts as needed.', 'To succeed in this role, you will apply your skillset to', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Excel at communicating across a broad set of cross-functional stakeholders.', 'MMIT is seeking experienced Data Scientists to meaningful contributes to the growth and development of the MMIT product portfolio. Ideal candidates are comfortable working with large, complex data sets to help inform, simplify and actualize key product capabilities. They will have comfort collaborating with various stakeholders and navigating ambiguity with limited direction. They will dedicate themselves to understanding the MMIT product portfolio (both current capabilities and future product roadmaps) and key data dependencies to inform data models, architecture, and new product development.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Bridge claims data and coverage data – Refine existing rules and create and continually improve new methods for accurately assigning pharmacy and medical claims volumes to MMIT controller entities', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Translate product management strategy into actionable data science deliverables, guiding development of data models, business rules and other advanced analytical capabilities', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Inform, create and/or maintain master data hierarchy, attributes and structure.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Effectively partner with external organizations including clients and vendors to develop meaning and projectable analytics about trends in market access dynamics across payers, geographies, indications, drugs, etc.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Work collaboratively with MMIT product and data teams to develop and/or commercialize analytics use cases that may include market access, coverage / lives, and RWE data', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Apply data science to the creation of short and long form geographic market and controller entity descriptive narratives (NLP / NLG)']

tweet\xa0', 'At\xa0Phreesia, we’re committed to helping healthcare organizations succeed in a fast-changing landscape—and we need smart, passionate people to help us do it. Our innovative SaaS platform offers our clients a suite of applications to manage the intake process, giving them the tools to engage patients, improve efficiency, optimize staffing and enhance clinical care.', 'Basically, what you do here matters, and hard work does not go unnoticed. Not only does Phreesia\xa0care about our clients, we also care about our employees. In fact, we’re a three-time winner of Modern Healthcare magazine’s Best Places to Work in Healthcare award.\xa0If you’re interested in consistent feedback and recognition, defined career paths, and the opportunity to work with driven and engaged colleagues in a dynamic industry, this may be the right opportunity for you.\xa0', '2+ years of experience in an operational Data\xa0Science\xa0role.\xa0', 'Navigate and use diverse machine learning stacks in Python\xa0and\xa0R\xa0', 'Mobile phone stipends and internet reimbursement', 'Phreesia is looking for an experienced and hands-on\xa0Data Scientist\xa0to join our growing Data Science Team; someone with extraordinary analytical and technical skills who is familiar with the entire lifecycle of a data science project, from data\xa0exploration,\xa0modeling\xa0and analysis,\xa0to\xa0model selection,\xa0validation,\xa0evaluation, and deployment.\xa0', 'MS/MA\xa0in\xa0a quantitative field such as\xa0data science,\xa0computer science, engineering,\xa0mathematics,\xa0statistics, computational linguistics, physics,\xa0or relevant equivalent professional experience\xa0', 'Nice to Have:', 'You will be joining a team of especially smart, humorous, quick-witted, and dedicated coworkers, all passionate about data and improving patient access to healthcare. You will\xa0be responsible for\xa0building data products for internal consumption, near real-time business intelligence tools, and predictive models. We are looking for someone\xa0experienced\xa0in\xa0partnering with business stakeholders, translating their needs into technical solutions and answers, and then building and delivering those solutions.\xa0This role will report directly to the Associate Director of Data Science.\xa0', 'Tuition and certification reimbursement, as well as other professional development opportunities']

You have expertise in at least one scripting language (ideally Python or R). You know how to use statistical inference to drive product and business recommendations. ", "You'll set the foundation for what data means at Notion, determining how we balance product intuition with analytical rigor.", "You'll design and enact the process for using statistical inference to evaluate the success of changes, from product launches to marketing campaigns.", "You'll build models to understand and predict things like user growth, product engagement, conversion, churn, and more.", "You've spent meaningful time as a data scientist.", 'You have led or managed a Data Science team.', 'About Us', 'You know how to use statistical inference to drive product and business recommendations.', " You'll set the foundation for what data means at Notion, determining how we balance product intuition with analytical rigor. (We currently use DBT, Snowflake, Mode Analytics, Fivetran, Census, Amplitude, Segment, and more). You'll collaborate with team leads across the business to understand and support their data needs. ', " Who you'll work with ", ' Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques ', ' So, you have colorful hair - Don’t care. Tattoos - Show off your ink. ', ' Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports and dashboards  Use CRBO to run reports and Snowflake queries to obtain data sets, thread with other data to provide key metrics and data points to drive business cases and decisions  Collaborate with business and IT teams to understand the different persona specific-use cases, the related business insight, consolidate use cases across persona and drive a common approach towards solving multiple use cases  Partner with cross-functional teams to realize data relationships through proper threading  Follow data privacy and protection processes required and implement systems and workflows that enforces security  Partner with Data Custodian/Stewards and other data management roles to ensure proper data operations improve quality, accessibility and value of consumed data  Partner with Ops and IT to develop CX-wide data and information architecture  Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques  Provide clear, impactful outputs that tell a story and point to key takeaways and learnings ', 'What You’ll Do', 'Data Analyst ', ' Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports and dashboards ', ' Use CRBO to run reports and Snowflake queries to obtain data sets, thread with other data to provide key metrics and data points to drive business cases and decisions ', ' Experience in Python/R and Data Warehousing required ', ' Experience with CRBO and Snowflake required ', ' Partner with Data Custodian/Stewards and other data management roles to ensure proper data operations improve quality, accessibility and value of consumed data ', ' We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. A blockchain company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box. ', ' Provide clear, impactful outputs that tell a story and point to key takeaways and learnings ', ' Minimum 3 years’ experience in SQL/NoSQL required ', ' Experience with Hadoop, Map Reduce, Webex Teams, AWS/Azure/Cloud experience preferred ', ' Preferred Masters/PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, or related field ', 'Who You Are', ' Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best and give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart! Because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward. ', ' Collaborate with business and IT teams to understand the different persona specific-use cases, the related business insight, consolidate use cases across persona and drive a common approach towards solving multiple use cases ', ' Partner with cross-functional teams to realize data relationships through proper threading ', ' Minimum Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, or related field ', ' 4-6 years of experience working with extremely large datasets, ETL processing and Machine learning pipelines ', ' Follow data privacy and protection processes required and implement systems and workflows that enforces security ']

Data Analyst to help improve our ability to inform Utility Operations about how, where, when, and why leaks occur in our natural gas pipeline distribution infrastructure. ['', 'The world is facing a medical crisis, bacteria are increasingly evolving resistance to even our strongest antibiotics.\xa0The problem is already very real and immediate; for example, bloodstream infection leading to sepsis is now responsible for more than half of all deaths in hospitals and is the most expensive condition treated in hospitals. Sepsis mortality rate increases >6% every hour without effective antibiotic treatment. Yet, despite the life and death urgency, and healthcare cost impacts, current methodologies require 3 days to determine the correct antibiotic.', 'Expert in R and proficient with C++ and Python.', 'MS degree in computer sciences, biomedical engineering, or related field and at least 5 years of interesting relevant experience.Expert in R and proficient with C++ and Python.Expertise in analytical methods and statistical analysis.Proficiency in SQL as well as NoSQL database technologies a plus.Full fluency (verbal and written) of the English language is a must.', 'The Job', 'The development and validation of applications for a medical instrument built under the guidance of a senior manager experienced in the application development discipline (so you’ll be learning the valuable skill of integrating your work into applications for medical diagnostic devices).', 'MS degree in computer sciences, biomedical engineering, or related field and at least 5 years of interesting relevant experience.', 'The application and development of suitable pre-processing, feature-selection and dimensional reduction techniques to detect, measure and account for data artifacts.', 'The Company', 'Proficiency in SQL as well as NoSQL database technologies a plus.', 'Expertise in analytical methods and statistical analysis.', 'Analytical methods and statistical analysis for processing high-volume, temporal high-dimensional data streams generated in real-time from our proprietary sensor technology.', 'This is not the job for a numbers only person. We want someone with a passion for and experience in the sciences that will lead you to look deeply into the sources of the data along with the scientists so that the data analysis is influenced by the science of our diagnostic technology and the science is influenced by the analysis.', 'You have a proven track record of successfully developing, validating and deploying data analysis and analytical methods to solve challenging real-world applications. You are deeply familiar with a broad range of analytical models and are at the pulse of developments in the field. Ideally you have proven expertise in the analysis of spatio-temporal data. You have a strong domain knowledge in the field of statistical analysis and signal processing. You should have a track record of success in your education and projects and have these characteristics and skills:', 'Specific Diagnostics has developed a breakthrough solution to rapidly determine the effective antibiotic treatment for bloodstream and other acute infections. Used for bloodstream infection Specific’s solution provides results 2 days sooner than existing methods, saving patients suffering from drug-resistant infection.\xa0', 'The development of data-driven visualization tools for the explorative analysis of high-dimensional data.', 'Analytical methods and statistical analysis for processing high-volume, temporal high-dimensional data streams generated in real-time from our proprietary sensor technology.The development of data-driven visualization tools for the explorative analysis of high-dimensional data.The application and development of suitable pre-processing, feature-selection and dimensional reduction techniques to detect, measure and account for data artifacts.The development and validation of applications for a medical instrument built under the guidance of a senior manager experienced in the application development discipline (so you’ll be learning the valuable skill of integrating your work into applications for medical diagnostic devices).Algorithm development for decisions and measurements from multi-dimensional data streams.', 'We have been funded by nearly $30 M in non-dilutive government sponsored research support and recently $17.5 M in venture capital. This is an opportunity to join us at an inflection point in our commercial growth as we bring our first key product to market and with recognition from major customers fueling an expansion of our staff.', 'This is the job for you if want to be where your ideas to be central to a world-changing and lifesaving product. Data science and analytics are at the core of our company we are seeking an exceptional talent to join our team. You will be a key contributor and critical to the success of the company. The main analysis tasks you are expected to contribute to are:', 'Full fluency (verbal and written) of the English language is a must.', 'You', 'Algorithm development for decisions and measurements from multi-dimensional data streams.']

comfortable interacting with colleagues at all levels.Team player with a flexible and adaptable approach to work, and a motivated self-starter.Knowledge of Banking or Capital Markets and familiar with current regulations such as BCBS 239, IFRS, CCAR, and an understanding of application data governance and data management (desirable, not essential).', 'We are looking for a Data Lineage Analyst in Weehawken, NJ for our direct financial client.', 'Your team:', 'The DMO is responsible for embedding a data management culture into the organization by advocating for our strategy and proactively challenging the way the firm works with data.\xa0', 'Methodical, concise and accurate, with strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills, including the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.', 'Knowledge of Banking or Capital Markets and familiar with current regulations such as BCBS 239, IFRS, CCAR, and an understanding of application data governance and data management (desirable, not essential).', 'Data Lineage Analyst', "Establish relationships across the organization to understand, interpret and document the bank's data flows, in line with the DMO methodology and framework;"]

['', 'We’re virtual', 'Superior ability to analyze and interpret the results of product experiments.', 'Have previous experience as technical lead on consumer products in the area of conversational assistants, chatbots, search, recommendation, personalization or related areas.', 'About Global Tech', 'Are a Self-starter, Quick learner, Keen observer, eye for detail and someone who relishes challenges', 'We’re virtual\xa0', 'Deep knowledge of machine learning, information retrieval, data mining, statistics, NLP or related field.', 'Being human-led is our true disruption.', 'Experience working with large data sets and distributed computing tools a plus (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark etc.)', 'Proven experience working with statistical languages such as R.', 'Strong communication skills both written and verbal', 'Ph.D. in computer science or similar field or MS with 3+ years of related experience', 'Have knowledge of Spark, Scikit-learn, problem solving, and are willing to learn new technologies.', 'Have a strong research and publication record', 'Working virtually this year has helped us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team, be more flexible in our personal lives and spend less time commuting.\xa0Today, we are reimagining the tech workplace of the future by making a permanent transition to virtual work for most of our team. Of course, being together in person is an important part of our culture and shared success. We’ll collaborate in person at a regular cadence and with purpose.\xa0\xa0\xa0', 'Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people and put a smile on their face. That’s what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We’re a team of 15,000+ software engineers, data scientists and service professionals within Walmart, the world’s largest retailer, delivering innovations that improve how our customers shop and empower our 2.2 million associates. To others, innovation looks like an app, service or some code,\xa0but Walmart has always been about people. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations.\xa0Being human-led is our true disruption.\xa0', "We're looking for:", 'Good functional coding skills in C++, Java, Scala in addition to good knowledge of one of the scripting languages such as Python or Perl.', 'About Global Tech\xa0', 'At the Walmart Voice Voice & Ubiquity team we are building completely new capabilities to allow our customers to shop seamlessly across devices like smart speakers, mobile phones, appliances etc using multi-modal conversational interfaces. This team is part of the Emerging Technology organization. Voice as a medium for shopping is still in its infancy and as part of this team you will get to work on industry leading solutions and be at the forefront of this emerging platform. You will get to be part of defining how customers shop in everyday lives. You can learn more about some of the work we do here:  https://medium.com/walmartglobaltech/building-a-conversational-assistant-platform-for-voice-enabled-shopping-6d174cdc4131', 'Have knowledge of Spark, Scikit-learn, problem solving, and are willing to learn new technologies.Are a Self-starter, Quick learner, Keen observer, eye for detail and someone who relishes challengesHave a strong research and publication recordHave previous experience as technical lead on consumer products in the area of conversational assistants, chatbots, search, recommendation, personalization or related areas.', 'Ph.D. in computer science or similar field or MS with 3+ years of related experienceDeep knowledge of machine learning, information retrieval, data mining, statistics, NLP or related field.Good functional coding skills in C++, Java, Scala in addition to good knowledge of one of the scripting languages such as Python or Perl.Experience working with large data sets and distributed computing tools a plus (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark etc.)Superior ability to analyze and interpret the results of product experiments.Proven experience working with statistical languages such as R.Strong communication skills both written and verbal', 'You will blow us away if you:', '\xa0']

['', 'Your role is incredibly data driven, whether that be understanding natural language, analysing trends or determining which of our products is best suited to a user - we have interesting problems to solve on an ever-increasing scale.\xa0', "Working with the Director of Value Creation, you will be responsible for deriving insights from specific customer data; helping them to be as successful as possible at predicting their customer's purchasing behaviour whilst also driving our ability to build effective business cases to increase our revenue stream with our customers themselves.Your role is incredibly data driven, whether that be understanding natural language, analysing trends or determining which of our products is best suited to a user - we have interesting problems to solve on an ever-increasing scale.\xa0You will proactively research, explore and examine data from a variety of angles to determine hidden weaknesses, trends and/or opportunities.You will build new tools to automate work or provide real-time reporting systems.Is able to translate numerical data into visual representations that convey a business-focus to our customers.", 'Marketing Data Scientist/Analyst - Software - AI Marketing Software Start-Up', '.', 'In order to apply for this role you will have the following experience:', 'Professional with skills in Data mining, Data cleaning and munging', 'Exposure to cloud-based data platforms, ideally BigQuery', 'Expert in Math (linear algebra, calculus, and probability), Statistics (hypothesis testing and summary statistics), Data visualization (BI, Looker, Google Sheets/Cloud) and reporting techniques', 'Experience with marketing data, metrics and KPIs\xa0would be an ideal but not essential', 'A self-starter that is not afraid to dig in and show initiative, to find creative solutions to problems and bring to the Director of Value Creation', "Orama are proud to announce their exclusive partnership with an AI Marketing Software Start-up who are tipped to be one of the biggest success stories of 2021. Their unique value proposition allows enterprise companies to understand and predict their customers' buying habits/patterns combining data gained from omnichannel marketing tech with the latest machine learning advances. Following their recent addtion of $40m+ round of funding, they are looking to hire a Data Science specialist who can help create value within their largest customers by deriving insights from data. This is a unique opportunity to play a pivotal role in their growth - GET IN TOUCH NOW!", 'Desired Skills and Experience', 'You will proactively research, explore and examine data from a variety of angles to determine hidden weaknesses, trends and/or opportunities.', 'Is able to translate numerical data into visual representations that convey a business-focus to our customers.', 'Basic $100K-150K + bonus + Stock + Benefits', 'Professional skills in programming (SQL databases, R, Python)', 'You will build new tools to automate work or provide real-time reporting systems.', 'Expert in Math (linear algebra, calculus, and probability), Statistics (hypothesis testing and summary statistics), Data visualization (BI, Looker, Google Sheets/Cloud) and reporting techniquesProfessional with skills in Data mining, Data cleaning and mungingProfessional skills in programming (SQL databases, R, Python)Exposure to cloud-based data platforms, ideally BigQueryExperience with ML tools and techniques (k-nearest neighbors, random forests, ensemble methods)Sophisticated with analytics programs, machine learning, and statistical methods and quick with preparing data for use in predictive and prescriptive modelingA self-starter that is not afraid to dig in and show initiative, to find creative solutions to problems and bring to the Director of Value CreationExperience with marketing data, metrics and KPIs\xa0would be an ideal but not essential', 'Sophisticated with analytics programs, machine learning, and statistical methods and quick with preparing data for use in predictive and prescriptive modeling', 'Experience with ML tools and techniques (k-nearest neighbors, random forests, ensemble methods)', "Working with the Director of Value Creation, you will be responsible for deriving insights from specific customer data; helping them to be as successful as possible at predicting their customer's purchasing behaviour whilst also driving our ability to build effective business cases to increase our revenue stream with our customers themselves."]

You will work hand in hand with our clinical, scientific and computational teams to analyze and present results generated from our proprietary datasets, such as the identification and study of a particular disease population or assessing the disease and drug mechanisms associated with new drug targets by navigating our rich and complex database. Central to this work will be an ability to think in a logical, structured fashion, work effectively in a highly collaborative environment and effectively communicate your findings to the rest of the team and ultimately to NashBio’s clients. ['', '2-5 years of experience as a Data/Business/Financial Analyst with large, complex data sources', 'Fidelity Life is a leading provider of financial security for middle market consumers. To complement this channel, the company recently expanded to offer an entirely digital purchase experience.', 'Together, Fidelity Life and eFinancial are revolutionizing the life insurance industry to make life insurance more accessible and affordable for everyday Americans. ['', 'Candidate must have an active TS/SCI with polygraph.', 'Requirements', 'This role will concentrate on data, pattern identification and analysis.\xa0As such will evaluate capabilities and analysis in Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, predictive modeling, statistical analysis and hypothesis testing', 'Candidate must have experience in Machine Learning', 'Identifies meaningful insights and interprets and communicates findings and recommendations.', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Experience with R and MapReduce', 'Candidate must have Bachelors with 4-8 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 2-6 years of prior relevant experience.', 'Experience with Splunk and deployment methodologies', 'Job Description ', 'Master’s degree in engineering, computer science, or other related technical field or Bachelor’s degree in a business or management-related field accompanied by experience managing technical requirements in complex programs.Candidate must have experience in Machine LearningExperience with developing Random Forests decision trees and subsequent analysis.Experience with Splunk and deployment methodologiesExperience with negotiating complex scenarios and challenges and devising courses of action to resolve situations with predictable outcomes.', 'Will research and explore emerging analytics and big-data technologies.', 'This role develops algorithms and analytical techniques to improve business performance.', 'Experience with negotiating complex scenarios and challenges and devising courses of action to resolve situations with predictable outcomes.', 'Works with cross-discipline teams to ensure connectivity between various data sources and business problems.', 'This role uses Data Science and Engineering techniques to satisfy customer requirements. Demonstrated ease to navigate in complex project environments and ability to communicate and influence senior management C-Level Executives. Commercial instinct to discover and develop new consulting opportunities. Previous experiences in analytics or solution consulting, either in consulting or advisory firm, software vendor, or as part of strategy function of a large corporation are a plus. Understanding of the software development life cycle, including business requirements definition, review of functional specifications, development of test plans, testing, user training, and deployment. ']

['', '1-2 years working in the pharmaceutical or health care industry is preferred', 'Desired Skills', 'Conversant in principles of the pharmaceutical industry', 'Experience with additional software such as R/Shiny, Python, Tableau, SAS, STATA, SPSS, TreeAge and other analytical software programsApplied econometrics or statistics knowledgeConversant in principles of the pharmaceutical industryAble to distill clinical information into compelling value statementsComfortable working in a fast-paced environmentFlexibility with working hours to accommodate project needsHigh level of focus and attention to detailAble to balance work on multiple assignmentsAbility to work effectively with multiple team members and managementEffective English communication, verbally and in writing1-2 years working in the pharmaceutical or health care industry is preferred', 'For more information or to apply for this position, please contact us at careers@bluepathsolutions.com.', 'Flexibility with working hours to accommodate project needs', 'Must Have Requirements', 'Multiple years of experience with Microsoft Excel-based modelingEducation in health services research, statistic/econometrics/biostatistics, business/economics/finance, computer science, data science, mathematics, pharmacy, or medicine', 'Able to balance work on multiple assignments', 'BluePath is a specialized consulting firm founded and led by well-versed, multi-disciplinary biopharmaceutical industry experts who provide a matrix level of support to our clients. BluePath offers consulting services which address the challenges associated with the optimization of pricing and reimbursement across the lifecycle of healthcare technologies. Our expertise spans both strategic and tactical aspects of market access, pricing and health economics.', 'Multiple years of experience with Microsoft Excel-based modeling', 'About BluePath Solutions', 'Modelers at BPS must have a strong understanding of modeling in Excel including model build from ground up, VBA coding, simulations, and user interfacing. Many models in the field continue to be based in Excel, but the industry is moving towards other platforms as well. A modeler with a biostatistical or econometric background is preferred. While much of modeling is done with a specific aim in mind, the modeler must be a self-starting, energetic, and creative individual who can question assumptions and clearly explain their methods. Modelers at BPS have the opportunity to contribute new methods to the field of health economics. This position will allow you to develop your leadership skills by providing strategic and methodological direction to a small team (n=1 or 2).', 'The ideal candidate would have at least three years of Excel-heavy modeling experience. The ability to be an excellent team player under tight deadlines coupled with the ability to tackle problems with imaginative solutions is a key to success in this position.', 'Effective English communication, verbally and in writing', 'Ability to work effectively with multiple team members and management', 'High level of focus and attention to detail', 'Able to distill clinical information into compelling value statements', 'Education in health services research, statistic/econometrics/biostatistics, business/economics/finance, computer science, data science, mathematics, pharmacy, or medicine', 'Applied econometrics or statistics knowledge', 'Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment', 'Experience with additional software such as R/Shiny, Python, Tableau, SAS, STATA, SPSS, TreeAge and other analytical software programs', 'BluePath is recruiting for its strategic health economics position acting as a modeler and data analyst. The position will be responsible for conceptualizing and designing economic models at an academic level suitable for publication. The models are primarily developed in Excel, with an emphasis on robust methods, accuracy, clean and appealing visualization, and interactivity. The models or the results of the models are often used to inform important coverage decisions for major pharmaceutical therapies or medical devices.']

['Mestag Therapeutics is a newly formed biotech, exploring emerging understanding of fibroblast subpopulations as targetable drivers of disease. Recent publications in Nature and other leading journals have illustrated that identifiable fibroblast subpopulations play distinct roles in driving disease across inflammatory and tumour disease microenvironments (Croft, AP et al, Nature 2019; Elyada et al Cancer Disc. 2019). Stromal signatures are increasingly associated with disease outcome and response to treatment including response to immunotherapy. This is an active and exciting space with rapidly emerging new data and significant academic and industry interest. Mestag’s mission is to lead the field in discovering, developing and delivering impactful precision medicines through unparalleled insight into pathological fibroblast sub-populations. Our initial focus is on unmet needs in solid tumours, including resistance to immunotherapy, and chronic inflammatory disease. ', '', 'Demonstrated success in managing complex large-scale data/bioinformatics projects within timeline and budget and developing specific tools for novel analyses', 'In addition, to thrive in this role, the successful applicant will need to think strategically, harness innovation, foster creativity, run complex operations and deliver solutions. This position will be highly visible and is expected to contribute significantly to the key needs and objectives of this transformative company. ', 'Create and lead the Mestag data science organization and grow the group into a world-leading function', '\xa0Identify and deliver key derisking and value-generating data packages focusing on critical path ', 'Note to agencies: Please do not send any speculative candidates as they will not be considered. We are working with a preferred supplier and do not need any further assitance.', 'Mestag boasts world class founders in fibroblast biology, inflammatory disease and oncology across the US & UK:', 'We are seeking a highly talented and experienced Head of Data Science to join our senior team and drive the development of a leading data science function. Our goal is to consolidate available datasets relating to fibroblast cell populations and other microenvironment constituents into an innovative and differentiated leading edge data function, a core foundation of the Company’s strategy. We are looking for a technically competent, driven and motivated Data Science lead to drive this initiative in a high profile senior role. Reporting to the CEO the position will serve as the technical and strategic director of data science activities and will work closely with Mestag’s Founders and other key external partners. The position could be based in the UK (London/Cambridge) or in the US (Boston).', 'Minimum 5 years of data science management experience within pharma/biotech or premier academic environment in particular in the fields of GWAS, single cell RNA seq, transcriptomics', 'We also offer the exciting opportunity to join a new company based on world-leading science early in its journey, providing possibility to shape and build our portfolio and strategy. In addition, you will play a key role in forming and living our company culture and values as our company grows. ', 'Proven experience in creating a culture of continuous improvement within a high-performing team', 'PhD in bioinformatics, computational biology, or equivalent and a strong publication record', 'Presentation of the function and output to key stakeholders, translating complex technical concepts for broader audiences', 'Create and lead the Mestag data science organization and grow the group into a world-leading functionLiaise with and work closely with high profile external academic and corporate partners; and assess, access and integrate clinical and other datasets across multiple types of data and analysesDeliver key analyses to support critical company decisions across Mestag’s portfolio\xa0Identify and deliver key derisking and value-generating data packages focusing on critical path Presentation of the function and output to key stakeholders, translating complex technical concepts for broader audiencesTo act as a thought partner to the CEO & Leadership Team in developing the Company’s strategy and contribute to defining the business strategy, portfolio decisions, strategic partnerships and fundraising activities', 'At Mestag, company culture is a critical driver of our success and will be front and centre as we develop and grow. The Company currently operates on a virtual model and anticipates moving into its own labs and offices early in 2021 on the London/Cambridge axis and establishing operations on East Coast US in the near future.', 'Excellent verbal and written communication skills', 'Key responsibilities of the role include:', 'The Head of Data Science will lead a growing team of direct reports and must have both a strategic and\xa0hands-on approach to executing the duties of the position. ', 'Chris Buckley, Kennedy Professor of Translational Rheumatology at the Kennedy Institute of Rheumatology, Oxford University. ', 'This is an excellent opportunity to join an exciting international new venture and help successfully build Mestag’s pipeline of therapeutic products. We offer a competitive salary plus bonus, and package including pension, healthcare, life insurance, generous vacation allowance and equity in the company. ', 'An ability to organize and prioritize resources to ensure short- and long-term targets are met', 'Michael Brenner, Chief of the Division of Rheumatology, Immunology, and Allergy at the Brigham and Women’s Hospital; David Tuveson, Roy J. Zuckerberg Professor of Cancer Research, and Director of the Cancer Center, Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory and President-elect AACR; Soumya Raychaudhuri, Professor of Medicine & Professor of Biomedical Informatics, Harvard Medical School and Member of the Broad Institute; Mark Coles, Honorary Professor of Immunology, Kennedy Institute of Rheumatology; and Chris Buckley, Kennedy Professor of Translational Rheumatology at the Kennedy Institute of Rheumatology, Oxford University. ', 'An ability to build appropriate networks and manage a range of stakeholder interests ', 'About Mestag Therapeutics', 'You will be required to partner with internal stakeholders to identify and translate immediate, short-term and long-term data science needs and requirements. You will own the company’s data integration roadmap to model future capabilities (what, how, who and when) and define common platform(s) and ways of working (governance, best practices, standards) to support all data science needs. You will actively contribute to the company’s strategy and the integration of data analytics as a core foundation of the company’s target discovery and therapeutic development activities.', 'Deliver key analyses to support critical company decisions across Mestag’s portfolio', 'We are backed by SV Health Investors, a leading life sciences & healthcare investor with over $3 billion in capital commitments raised across seven private venture capital funds and one publicly listed fund. SV has a 25-year track record in the US and Europe with offices in Boston and London. This investment has been committed from the SV’s newest life sciences fund, the Impact Medicine Fund, which invests in precision medicine therapeutics in areas of high unmet need.', 'Mark Coles, Honorary Professor of Immunology, Kennedy Institute of Rheumatology; and ', 'To act as a thought partner to the CEO & Leadership Team in developing the Company’s strategy and contribute to defining the business strategy, portfolio decisions, strategic partnerships and fundraising activities', 'Hands-on experience implementing complex data integration solutions and underlying IT architectures and services', 'PhD in bioinformatics, computational biology, or equivalent and a strong publication recordMinimum 5 years of data science management experience within pharma/biotech or premier academic environment in particular in the fields of GWAS, single cell RNA seq, transcriptomicsDemonstrated success in managing complex large-scale data/bioinformatics projects within timeline and budget and developing specific tools for novel analysesStrong external network in data analytics, ideally in human disease tissue analysisHands-on experience implementing complex data integration solutions and underlying IT architectures and servicesExperience with connecting and understanding of the associated biology, ideally in inflammatory disease and/or oncologyExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAn ability to develop and encourage cross-functional working relationshipsAn ability to organize and prioritize resources to ensure short- and long-term targets are metProven experience in creating a culture of continuous improvement within a high-performing teamExperience of leading strategic debate to identify future opportunities An ability to build appropriate networks and manage a range of stakeholder interests ', 'Led by Executive Chair Houman Ashrafian, CEO Susan Hill and CSO Edith Hessel, the Company is assembling a driven, motivated team to explore new therapeutic opportunities and currently numbers 10 people bringing expertise from roles in GSK, Biogen, AbbVie, F-Star, ImmunoCore, and Alexion.\xa0Board members include Kate Bingham, Managing Partner SV Health Investors, Kevin Lee, CEO Bicycle Therapeutics and Neil Weir, CEO Sitryx. ', 'This position requires:', 'Liaise with and work closely with high profile external academic and corporate partners; and assess, access and integrate clinical and other datasets across multiple types of data and analyses', 'Reward', 'The Position', 'Experience with connecting and understanding of the associated biology, ideally in inflammatory disease and/or oncology', 'Soumya Raychaudhuri, Professor of Medicine & Professor of Biomedical Informatics, Harvard Medical School and Member of the Broad Institute; ', 'If you feel you have got what it takes to join a vibrant new company, then we would love to hear from you.\xa0', 'Michael Brenner, Chief of the Division of Rheumatology, Immunology, and Allergy at the Brigham and Women’s Hospital; ', 'David Tuveson, Roy J. Zuckerberg Professor of Cancer Research, and Director of the Cancer Center, Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory and President-elect AACR; ', 'Strong external network in data analytics, ideally in human disease tissue analysis', 'Underpinning Mestag’s ambitions are an initial portfolio of antibody targets. The lead focus is a possible first-in-class target which may generate multiple therapeutic programs and alter signalling pathways known to play a prominent role in both inflammatory disease and oncology. Through its founders, Mestag has identified several other high value targets to pursue. Mestag’s business model is focused on building a highly desirable portfolio, and the company will seek to supplement these initial targets with a pipeline of early targets generated by its novel target discovery platform.', 'An ability to develop and encourage cross-functional working relationships', 'Experience of leading strategic debate to identify future opportunities ', '\xa0']

['', 'Other:', 'Education:', '* Minimum of five years of experience in biostatistics, research methods, epidemiology, or statistical modeling is required, preferably in a health care or pharmaceutical industry', '*Minimum of five years managing staff of analytical staff and resources', "Creating economic models to perform cost-effectiveness analysis for assigned clients ensuring to customize the presentation of the results to the client's needs", '*Strong multi-tasking and organizational abilities', '*Sense of urgency necessary to meet goals, objectives, and deadlines', '*Exercise independent judgment', '*Doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with major coursework in Health', 'At Intrado, we are dedicated to delivering and improving upon new channels, new capabilities and new choices for how businesses and consumers collaborate, connect and transact. We develop technology-enabled communications that change the way we work and improve the way we live. We are a collective effort of enterprise and individuals, of communities and customers, of partnerships and families. We are the sum of our entire network – based on the four pillars of trust, innovation, collaboration, and execution and the hard work of people who share our vision. We are at the core of a technology and communications engine that is changing the world.', 'MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS', "*Master's degree from an accredited college or university with major coursework in Health", 'Writing and developing manuscripts for peer reviewed journals based on health outcomes research', 'We are delivering on their potential.', '*Demonstrated leadership abilities, accountability, and initiative', 'Experience:', 'The core focus of this position will be overseeing the performance of complex health outcomes analysis utilizing large administrative datasets that include medical and pharmacy insurance claims, eligibility files, and other ancillary data such as lab and survey data.', 'Key areas of emphasis include:', 'Applicant for this job will be expected to meet the following minimum qualifications.', '*Completion of a doctoral degree may be substituted for educational requirements', 'Conducting retrospective analysis through the implementation of study design and statistical methods using established software (e.g. SAS, Excel), ensuring to note any potential errors that may have affected the analysis', 'We are improving the way we work and live.', '*Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage complex projects and timelines in a matrix team environment', 'We Connect.\xa0We Deliver.\xa0We are Intrado.', '*Minimum of five years of experience in healthcare data, quality and efficiency of care measurement.', '* Experience with the peer reviewed journal submission process is preferred', '*Demonstrated problem solving, analytical reasoning, and decision-making skills', 'Intrado is connecting people and ideas.', 'Skills:', 'Economics and Outcomes Research, Health Services, or a related field is required. (Master’s degree with ten year of related experience may be considered in lieu of Doctorate)', '*Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word is required', 'Intrado’s Engage2Health (e2H) group is looking for a Director of Health Outcomes to add to its team in Westlake Village, CA.', 'Engage2Health (e2H) is the analytics and informatics division of Health Advocate, Inc. Health Advocate is the nation’s leading health care advocacy and assistance company, serving more than 9,000 clients and nearly 24 million people across the country. The company offers a range of personalized services to help employees and their families navigate the complex health and insurance systems. The ultimate goal is to help improve employee health care outcomes while simultaneously reducing medical expenditures.\xa0In order to serve the needs of a diverse clientele, engage2Health specializes in health services and outcomes research and population management interventions. The e2H team integrates complex sources of health care data to provide customized solutions that promote quality and value in health care. The company is committed to the academic integrity of its programs and maintains a portfolio of peer-reviewed studies that adhere to rigorous scientific standards.', "Overseeing department team members to cultivate ideas and research for peer reviewed journal topics to enhance the organization's visibility in the health outcomes research industry", '*Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communications skills', 'Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled', '*Time spent in pursuit of a doctorate degree may be substituted for work experience', 'Economics and Outcomes Research, Health Services, or a related field is required']

['', 'Must be motivated, independent, detail-oriented, and organized, as well as a strong team player and effective communicator.', 'Assist with research projects that explore EM, PTNS, or observer data collection.', 'Working with marine fisheries information programs or other science-based programs.', 'Lynker Technologies, LLC is a growing, Hub-zone certified small business specializing in professional, scientific and technical services. Our continually expanding team combines scientific expertise with mature, results-driven processes and tools to achieve technically sound, cost effective solutions in hydrology/water sciences, geospatial analysis, information technology, resource management, conservation, and management and business process improvement.', 'Must be willing and available to provide PTNS support after-hours on nights, weekends and holidays (this work is generally minimal and can be performed from home)', "Assist with monitoring vessels' PTNS compliance.", 'Excellent verbal and written communication skills', 'Assist with PTNS and EM outreach as requested.', 'Lynker Technologies, LLC is seeking to hire a Pre-Trip Notification System (PTNS) & Electronic Monitoring (EM) Data Analyst to support the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS) Northeast Fisheries Science Center (NEFSC) Fishery Sampling Branch (FSB) at the NOAA Facility in Tech Park East, Falmouth, MA. ', 'Minimum required qualifications include:', "The FSB provides the Northeast Fisheries Observer Program (NEFOP) observer coverage and ASM coverage of several Northeast and Mid-Atlantic Federal and state fisheries through the NEFOP and the At-Sea Monitoring (ASM) program. FSB staff trains and monitors the performance of NEFOP observers and ASMs, who complete data collection and biological sampling on board commercial fishing vessels from Maine to North Carolina, USA. Selection of vessels and deployment of observers and ASMs varies by fishery. In the Northeast multispecies groundfish fishery and the longfin squid fishery, selection is managed by the PTNS. The PTNS is a web-based system used by all groundfish sector vessels and select non-sector vessels. They  are required to provide 48 hours' notice prior to each PTNS-eligible fishing trip. Notifications are made by vessel representatives via direct use of the PTNS website, phone calls, or emails, 24 hours per day, 7 days per week. FSB staff provides live support for the PTNS Monday through Friday during office hours and intermittent support outside of office hours - nights, weekends, and holidays as needed. An after-hours answering service Contractor provides PTNS telephone support nightly, and on weekends and holidays. In order to provide PTNS support to the groundfish and longfin squid industries and to NEFOP and ASM providers, FSB staff must answer phone calls and respond to inquiries in a polite and courteous manner. Additionally, regular database maintenance tasks must be performed to ensure accuracy of trip counts, compliance monitoring and observer coverage metrics. Sector, vessel, and provider-specific PTNS data summaries, as well as system analyses are required on a regular basis. Biopharmaceutical leader founded on discovering, developing, manufacturing, and delivering innovative human therapeutics. The scientist will be responsible for the data verification, drafting, reviewing, and compilation for method transfer and method validation protocols and reports. The position will be a documentation centric role and the candidate will need to have experience with document management systems. The Scientist role in Commercial Process Development will be part of a team responsible for authoring method transfer and method validation protocols and reports for late stage programs for the following method platforms: Chromatography, Bioassay, Device, PCR, Microbiology, Immunoassay, CE/Gel, Viral, and General. Protocols and reports will be authored according to regulatory and industry guidelines (i.e., ICH). Direct experience with method transfer and method validation processes from a Pharmaceutical or Biotechnology Company. Knowledge of analytical methods/technologies used in biologic and synthetic development and manufacturing. Excellent written and oral communication skills for the timely documentation, presentation, and discussion of scientific results in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary, team-based environment. Demonstrated ability to critically analyze and interrogate various analytical data sets to drive and influence the process. Demonstrated ability to propose and drive new scientific initiatives. Client is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. ', 'Candidate can sit anywhere within US & work any time zone: fully remote.']

['', 'Education:', 'About Us: ', 'Qualifications:', 'Help the team deliver its best work: ', ' ', 'This role will be a good fit for people who naturally push towards progress and are undeterred when that requires a lot of effort or stepping into unfamiliar territory. Emendata is growing rapidly, and we are looking for people who are excited to march forward together.', 'Education: Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative field or equivalent technical trainingProgramming: Experience with SAS is a must (comfortable with SAS macro language, advanced DATA step techniques such as hashes, and PROC SQL); experience with Python, Stata, R, or SQL is a plus Technical Mentorship: Demonstrated experience with reviewing code and providing feedbackData Management: Comfortable with the process of importing, cleaning, and preparing data for analysis in a reproducible wayAnalysis: Exceptional problem-solving skills with a good understanding of statistical/social science research methods; 4+ years hands-on experience in an analytics role (e.g., economic consulting)Working Style: Intellectually curious (keep pulling on threads until finding an answer), enterprising (eager to tackle the unknown and find a way to make things happen), and collaborative (work with others to explore, build, tear down, and build again)', 'Working Style: Intellectually curious (keep pulling on threads until finding an answer), enterprising (eager to tackle the unknown and find a way to make things happen), and collaborative (work with others to explore, build, tear down, and build again)', 'To be considered for this position, applicants must have the ability to work in the U.S. without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.', 'Take analyses from end to end: ', 'Working Style:', 'Apply a research mentality: ', 'Technical Mentorship: ', 'Data Management: ', 'Take analyses from end to end: Understand the client’s problem, identify the right research question, plan the methodology, corral the data, code the analysis, interpret the results, craft the deliverable, and communicate the storyApply a research mentality: Use all tools at our disposal (documentation, policy regulations, data investigations, etc.) to make sound analytic decisionsHelp the team deliver its best work: Turn direction from clients/senior staff into tactical plans and work closely with data analysts to help them implement (conducting code reviews, teaching/reinforcing analytic strategies, etc.)', 'Data Management: Comfortable with the process of importing, cleaning, and preparing data for analysis in a reproducible way', 'About Us: At Emendata, we help bridge the gap between data and the real world. We partner with organizations that have a social mission and help them tackle their problems using analytics. Our role in these partnerships goes end to end—we handle everything from wrangling the data to analyzing the problem to turning the results into something actionable. Importantly, we understand that this analytics pipeline does not live in a vacuum. Getting to meaningful numbers requires more than just the right methods; it calls for understanding the people, policies, data, and systems involved. With this approach, our small but fast-growing team is having a big impact, taking on challenges like using analytics to combat fraud, waste, and abuse in Medicare.', 'Programming: Experience with SAS is a must (comfortable with SAS macro language, advanced DATA step techniques such as hashes, and PROC SQL); experience with Python, Stata, R, or SQL is a plus ', 'About the Interview Process:', 'Programming:', 'Analysis: ', 'Take analyses from end to end: Understand the client’s problem, identify the right research question, plan the methodology, corral the data, code the analysis, interpret the results, craft the deliverable, and communicate the story', 'Education: Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative field or equivalent technical training', 'Apply a research mentality: Use all tools at our disposal (documentation, policy regulations, data investigations, etc.) to make sound analytic decisions', 'About the Role: ', 'Help the team deliver its best work: Turn direction from clients/senior staff into tactical plans and work closely with data analysts to help them implement (conducting code reviews, teaching/reinforcing analytic strategies, etc.)', 'Analysis: Exceptional problem-solving skills with a good understanding of statistical/social science research methods; 4+ years hands-on experience in an analytics role (e.g., economic consulting)', 'About the Interview Process: We want both sides to learn what it would be like to work together. Part way through the interview process, we incorporate a lightweight at-home exercise that serves as the basis for a technical interview. The exercise gives us an outlet to show you what kind of problems this role would tackle and offers you an opportunity to show us how you would approach the work.', 'Technical Mentorship: Demonstrated experience with reviewing code and providing feedback', 'About the Role: This role leads the way in producing analytics that reflect a deep level of understanding and a high degree of quality. We are looking for you to:', 'Qualifications: If you do not meet all the criteria below but still think you would be a good fit for this role, please apply so we can see if we can find the right spot for you on the team. We value experience but also welcome aptitude and enthusiasm. ', '\xa0']

["Calling the adventurers ready to join a company that's pushing the limits of nanotechnology to keep the digital revolution rolling. At KLA, we're making technology advancements that are bigger—and tinier—than the world has ever seen. ", 'sivaram.bose@kla.com', 'Responsibilities: ', 'Group/Division', 'Qualifications:', ' ', 'Equal Employment Opportunity', 'Qualifications: ', 'Candidate should be familiar with statistical analysis, control theory, and semiconductor manufacturing, and should be comfortable with scripting, Matlab or Python, and statistics packages such as JMP. Familiarity with at least one of the programming languages such as C/C++ or C# will be a plus. Should be an independent self-starter, work well on teams, and have good communication skills. ', 'Minimum Qualifications ', '\xa0 ', 'Group/Division ', 'As a part of this group, you will be part of a world class team of physicists, HPC system designers, machine learning and application engineers who build cutting edge solutions for modeling complex imaging techniques and semiconductor processes.  You will also work with a data scientists and AI infrastructure engineers whose mission is to build and scale machine learning based solutions for our semiconductor customers. ', 'Kindly send your resumes to sivaram.bose@kla.comEqual Employment OpportunityKLA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.', "Who are we?  We research, develop, and manufacture the world's most advanced inspection and measurement equipment for the semiconductor and nanoelectronics industries. We enable the digital age by pushing the boundaries of technology, creating tools capable of finding defects smaller than a wavelength of visible light. We create smarter processes so that technology leaders can manufacture high-performance chips—the kind in that phone in your pocket, the tablet on your desk and nearly every electronic device you own—faster and better. We're passionate about creating solutions that drive progress and help people do what wouldn't be possible without us.  The future is calling. Will you answer? ", 'We are looking for engineers in a few different fields.  If you are passionate about Physics Modeling, High Performance Computing - HPC (including GPU), ML, Data, or Cloud technologies – this is the place for you! ', 'KLA has always had a close relationship with physics and data.  Our optical and electron beam inspection and measurement tools use cutting edge physics models, both for hardware design and as part of their algorithms.  AI, including several traditional machine learning techniques and deep learning are routinely used to process this data to meet application requirements. ', 'Company Overview ', 'Company Overview', 'The AI & Modeling Center of Excellence, centered in KLA’s R&D facility in Ann Arbor, MI, was setup with the mission of advancing KLA’s traditional strengths in physics and data and providing implementation solutions for multiple KLA Inspection and Metrology products targeted at the semiconductor manufacturing industry. ', 'Minimum Qualifications', "We have an opening for a research scientist to work on process control for edge placement error (EPE).  Edge Placement Error analysis is an expansion of CD uniformity (CDU) and overlay control to account for the more complex interactions in leading-edge multi-patterning and process integration schemes. This research position will have three focus areas.  First, the research scientist will work on a team to develop statistics-based analysis techniques for data streams from KLA's metrology tools, such as the Archer (overlay), SpectraShape (CD), and PWG (wafer shape) tools.  This analysis will require standard techniques such as noise filtering and linear regression, as well as more advanced methods such as machine learning, dimensionally reduction, and big data analytics.  Second, physics-based models will be developed that are related to the physical processes used in semiconductor manufacturing, in order to combine measurements in a meaningful way.  For example, analyzing how wafer bending modes due to film stress can induce overlay errors.  Finally, these models will be combined with feed-forward and feed-back control methods, and the researcher will analyze these process control loops for stability and effectiveness in reducing manufacturing errors. ", "Doctorate (Academic) OR Master's Level Degree with at least 2 years of experience. OR Bachelor's Level Degree with at least 3 years of experience. ", 'Responsibilities:']

['You will have an opportunity to work on a small and growing team based in San Francisco in an environment where engineering is central to what we do. ['', 'Required Skills And Experience', 'Additional Locations', 'Company Description', "SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT ", 'Research Projects: A Senior Data Scientist working in research projects leads small project teams of researchers or participates in such projects as key contributor. In this role the Senior Data Scientist is performing functional and empirical analysis on data mining topics. Conducts research on data mining tools and algorithms, implements prototypes and data mining algorithms and validates them on real data. Creates best practices for data mining topics and collaborates with development, universities and research institutes.', 'Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills to effectively prepare and present reports, forecasts, trends and actionable insights to executive, business and technical teams', '.', 'Requisition ID: ', 'Employment Type: ', 'Independent of the working area the Senior Data Scientist constantly improves own work methods and enhances skills beyond own core functional focus and works on other tasks for the benefit of the team. Has advanced overall data mining/machine learning and technical knowledge (e.g. in programming, data mining tools, Big Data technologies) and experience which he/she shares within and across teams. ', 'A Senior Data Scientist creates data definitions and contributes to data storage infrastructure for data mining purposes and to Data Mining architectures. Resolves data mining performance issues and monitors data mining system performance and implements efficiency improvements. ['', 'Skills and Abilities:', 'Position Title:\xa0\xa0 Systems Analyst IV - Data Engineering\xa0 ', 'Principle Duties and Responsibilities', 'Strong Organization Skills:', 'Preferred Qualification:', ' ', 'Systems Analyst IV - Data Engineering\xa0', 'Position Summary:', 'Strong Analytical Aptitude:', 'Basic Requirements:', 'Position Summary:\xa0\xa0 ', ' Systems Analyst IV - Data Engineering\xa0', '     The Data Science Systems Analyst plays a critical role in the industrialization  of data science initiatives across the organization. Engages with Data Science  teams through the entire lifecycle of all the projects within Business  Intelligence & Analytics department from data modeling, to data engineering,  and finally data consumptionPrinciple Duties and Responsibilities     • Works with data scientist to design, develop, test, and implement algorithms  using the Data & Analytics Platform.• Solves moderate to complex product  errors, as well as designs and resolves product problems, following up in a  timely manner with all appropriate customers and IT personnel.• Develop data  engineering processes in azure using components like Azure Data Factory, Azure  Data Lake analytics, HDInsights, DataBricks etc.• Assists in assessing  alternative software solutions for workability and technical feasibility.•  Relates information from various sources to draw logical conclusions.•  Assists in identifying the impact of proposed development/enhancements  projects.• Knowledge of data science tools and platforms (preferably  Microsoft Azure) • Knowledge of statistical and predictive modeling concepts  and disciplines including machine learning algorithms• Knowledge of  industry-leading practices• Ability to propose analytic strategies and  solutions as a business need• Analyzing source system data and data flows,  working with structured and unstructured data• Manipulating high-volume,  high-dimensionality data from varying sources to highlight patterns, anomalies,  relationships and trends• Must possess the ability to effectively  communicate using strong verbal, written and listening skills• Must be able  to adapt quickly to change without being afraid to take on new responsibilities  in a fast-paced team environment while being proactive and action-oriented •  Ability to come up with creative technical ways to resolve application and  system issues• Understanding agile development methodologies or concepts;  experience with is a plus• Excellent diagnostic, debugging, and  troubleshooting skills• Working knowledge of any of the following languages:  Python, Java, R, SQL, HQL, Gremlin, Cypher• Delivers SDLC Deliverables as  defined.• Contributes to Business Case Development through information  gathering and analysis.    Basic Requirements:     • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business  Administration, or other related field. • Minimum of 5 years IT experience  encompassing the following:\xa0 o Working experience with SDLC and deliverables  associated with each phase.\xa0 o Experience in ML algorithms and Advanced SQL  techniques\xa0 o Experience engineering data pipelines using latest technologies  and techniques\xa0 o Experience in Data Visualization Best Practices\xa0 o  Experience working with industry-leading tools and technologies \xa0 o Experience  in Azure Cloud technologies\xa0 o Experience in Big Data / Hadoop Skills and Abilities:     • Intellectual curiosity and great data intuition• The basics: Statistical  Analysis, Data Mining and Processing, Programming, Machine Learning, Linear  Algebra and Calculus, Data Visualization, Data Wrangling, Software  Engineering• Adept at working with unstructured data• Outstanding  Written and Verbal Communication communications skills; able to articulate  complex technical topics for non-technical audiences.• Ability to analyze  complex situations and develop creative solutions.• Ability to multi-task  and self-direct.Strong Organization Skills:• Ability to interact  with non IT associates and management on projects.• Ability to plan and  organize work to meet pre-established deadlines. • Ability to work with  their peers, associates and all levels of management.• Ability to explain  technical concepts in a non-technical fashion.• Strong problem-solving and  critical thinking skills; strong deductive and inductive  reasoning.Strong Analytical Aptitude:• Ability to work with and  influence peers and senior management.• Ability to work in a fast-paced and  deadline-oriented environment.• Self-motivated with critical attention to  detail, deadlines and reporting.Preferred Qualification:• Experience  in a retail environment a plus.']
